Mr. Speaker, I rise to a point of Order. Listening to your Announcement about this Select Committee, I think it should normally consist of all the parties. The Chief Opposition Whip must make sure that the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress is also there. Among the names that you read out- ( ) (Mr. Speaker) , ?

() , , , 6 . . 2007 ? () ? () ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Nation Building and Estate Infrastructure Development,(1) (a) Is he aware that the Samurdhi assistance provided to Mrs. P.G. Gunawathie of No.06, Dikdeniya, Hodiyadeniya, Kirinda in Gampola, has been cancelled from November 2007?

(b) Will he admit that Mrs. Gunawathie and her husband are very old persons who are not in a position to engage in any work and they do not get any help from anybody as their children, who are married and live in other areas? (c) Will he inform this House the reason for canceling the Samurdhi assistance provided to such a helpless family? (d) Will he take necessary action to provide this family with the Samurdhi assistance again? (e) If not, why?

asked the Minister of Petroleum and Petroleum Resources Development, : (a) Is he aware that (i) Mr. M. Ashroff Ali residing at No.42/A, Marukona, Ukuwela, served at the Peradeniya petroleum storage terminal of Ceylon Petroleum Corporation; and (ii) he was transferred immediately to Kolonnawa storage terminal with effect from 30.04.2004?

(b) Will he admit that (i) as a result of this transfer which was done as an act of political victimization, he has been chased away without allowing him to assume duties at the new working place; and (ii) he has lost his job, as a result of the above mentioned situation? (c) Will he make the necessary arrangements to enable him to work safely at his former place of work? (d) If not, why? . . . ( ) ( . . . - , ) (The Hon. A. H. M. Fowzie - Minister of Petroleum and Petroleum Resources Development) (a) (i) Yes. (ii) Yes. (b) (i) No. (ii) No. (c) He had been treated as having vacated the post due to non reporting to work without permission. (d) He was reinstated on sympathetic grounds. However, this person who had been reinstated after having vacated the post, had subsequently gone on excessive no-pay leave, continuously, and therefore he lost his job. ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) He was not allowed to report to work.

There is nothing like that. . . ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) He had made an entry in the police station and a copy of the police report is with him. . . . ( . . . ) (The Hon. A. H. M. Fowzie) No, that is not so. ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) I can provide that report.
. . . ( . . . ) (The Hon. A. H. M. Fowzie) Then he should have reported it at least to me; he should have brought it to my notice. ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) I will bring it to your notice.

. . . ( . . . ) (The Hon. A. H. M. Fowzie) We reinstated him. But subsequently he had not gone to work for a long period and he lost his job. ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) He has been assaulted and he had been compelled to-
. . . ( . . . ) (The Hon. A. H. M. Fowzie) Let him make an appeal. I will look into that.

asked the Minister of Land and Land Development,: (a) Will he inform this House whether it has been decided that when providing alternative lands for the victims of the Tsunami disaster, the recipients of lands will be given total freehold rights after ten years as a condition and within that ten years, lands can be transferred only to the members of the family of the recipient? (b) Will he state whether this decision will also be implemented with regard to the lands that have already been distributed by the Government under Swarnabhoomi, Jayabhoomi and other names? (c) If not, why?
( . . - , ) (The Hon. C. A. Suriyaarachchi - Deputy Minister of Lands and Land Development) () . 20 6 . .

: : RESEARCH INSTITUTE AFFILIATED TO MINISTRY OF INDIGENOUS MEDICINE : RESEARCH 0646/08 12. ( ) (The Hon. Thilakaratne Withanachchi) (1) : () 1962 , 2007 ? () (i) 45 ; (ii) , ; (iii) ; ? () (i) /// 2005.05.25 , , ; (ii) ; ? () 2008 , ? () , ? : () 1962 , 2007 ? () (i) 45 , (ii) , , , (iii) ,

asked the Minister of Indigenous Medicine: (a) Is he aware that even though the research institute affiliated to the Ministry of Indigenous Medicine was founded in 1962, results of only one research have been published by the year 2007? (b) Will he submit to this House in detail, (i) the number of doctors who had come forward to conduct researches with relevance to various diseases, within the last 45 years; (ii) the names and addresses of those doctors and the names of the diseases for which the researches were proposed; and (iii) the obstacles which impeded the conducting of those researches? (c) Is he aware that, (i) Ayurvedic Doctor Sumith Rajapura who owns Sirigala Rajapura Veda Medura at Monaragala was invited to conduct a research on asthma by the letter of the then Commissioner of Ayurveda, Mr. Vajira Narampanawa, bearing No. Ayu/Co/P/Misc. and dated 25.05.2005; and (ii) the relevant Commissioner had informed that it was difficult to conduct this research due to lack of financial provisions and the above- mentioned doctor had proposed to carry out this research at his own expense? (d) Will he take steps to convene all the doctors who had offered to carry out important researches of this manner and provide for them to carry out researches on diseases selected on priority basis, within the first quarter of year 2008 under his leadership? (e) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Tissa Karalliyadde) , . . ? ( ) (The Hon. Thilakaratne Withanachchi) . ( ) (The Hon. Tissa Karalliyadde) * .

asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Management and Minister of Ports and Aviation, : (a) Will he inform this House (i) separately, the total number of tanks that belong to the categories of minor irrigations and major irrigations in the Puttalam Divisional Secretarys Division; (ii) separately, the extent of reservations of the aforesaid tanks;

(iii) the year in which the surveys have been carried out for the last time for the purpose of identifying the aforesaid reservations; (iv) whether there are occupants in the aforesaid reservations; (v) if there are occupants, whether they occupy the aforesaid reservations on any legal basis; and (vi) the relevant year, the basis and the duration of their occupation? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) separately, the names and addresses of the persons occupying the aforesaid reservations in respect of minor irrigations and major irrigations; (ii) whether alternative lands have been identified for the distribution to the aforesaid occupants of the reservations of tanks; (iii) if so, the locations of those lands; and (iv) if alternative lands have not been identified, the date on which action will be taken to grant them? (c) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Chamal Rajapaksa) () (i) . (ii) . (iii) . (iv) . (v) . (vi) . () (i) . (ii) . (iii) . (iv) . () . , , , . . . : : ANAMADUWA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION:TANKS
asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Management and Minister of Ports and Aviation, :
(a) Will he inform this House (i) separately, the total number of tanks that belong to the categories of minor irrigations and major irrigations in the Anamaduwa Divisional Secretarys Division;

(ii) separately, the extent of reservations of the aforesaid tanks; (iii) the year in which the surveys have been carried out for the last time for the purpose of identifying the aforesaid reservations; (iv) whether there are occupants in the aforesaid reservations; (v) if there are occupants, whether they occupy the aforesaid reservations on any legal basis; and (vi) the relevant year, the basis and the duration of their occupation? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) separately, the names and addresses of the persons occupying the aforesaid reservations in respect of minor irrigations and major irrigations; (ii) whether alternative lands have been identified for the distribution to the aforesaid occupants of the reservations of tanks; (iii) if so, the locations of those lands; and (iv) if alternative lands have not been identified, the date on which action will be taken to grant them? (c) If not, why?
. . . . . ( ) (The Hon. Chamal Rajapaksa) . ( ) (The Hon. Samansiri Herath) .

. . Question ordered to stand down. : , : MINISTER OF CULTURAL AFFAIRS AND NATIONAL HERITAGE : OFFICIAL RESIDENCE

asked the Minister of Cultural Affairs and National Heritage : (a) Will he inform this House (i) whether an official residence has been provided for the Minister of Cultural Affairs and National Heritage (Cabinet); (ii) if so, whether it is a property owned by the State; and (iii) if it is not owned by the State, the basis on which it has been allocated? (b) Will he submit to this House separately (i) if an official residence has been allocated, whether it has been repaired or upgraded during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) if it has been repaired, the amount of money spent in each year for that purpose; (iii) whether furniture or any other equipment for the use of the aforesaid official residence, has been purchased at Government expense during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (iv) if so, the amount spent on them?

(c) Will he state (i) separately, the number of units of electricity and water that have been used at this official residence during each month of the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (ii) the amount of money spent by the relevant Ministry for electricity and water used at the above mentioned official residence in each month of the aforesaid years? (d) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , * .

: , : MINISTER OF ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT AND INVESTMENT PROMOTION : OFFICIAL RESIDENCE 0199/08 4. ( . . . ) ( - . . . - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi on behalf of (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) , (1) : () (i) () ; (ii) , ; (iii) ; ? () (i) , 2005, 2006 2007 ;
asked the Minister of Enterprise Development and Investment Promotion : -(1) (a) Will he inform this House
(i) whether an official residence has been provided for the Minister of Enterprise Development and Investment Promotion (Cabinet);

(ii) if so, whether it is a property owned by the State; and (iii) if it is not owned by the State, the basis on which it has been allocated? (b) Will he submit to this House separately (i) if an official residence has been allocated, whether it has been repaired or upgraded during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) if it has been repaired, the amount of money spent in each year for that purpose; (iii) whether furniture or any other equipment for the use of the aforesaid official residence, has been purchased at Government expense during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (iv) if so, the amount spent on them? (c) Will he state (i) separately, the number of units of electricity and water that have been used at this official residence during each month of the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (ii) the amount of money spent by the relevant Ministry for electricity and water used at the above mentioned official residence in each month of the aforesaid years? (d) If not, why?
( - . . . - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi - on behalf of The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) - (1) :

(a) Will he inform this House (i) whether an official residence has been provided for the Minister of Transport (Cabinet); (ii) if so, whether it is a property owned by the State; and (iii) if it is not owned by the State, the basis on which it has been allocated? (b) Will he submit to this House separately (i) if an official residence has been allocated, whether it has been repaired or upgraded during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) if it has been repaired, the amount of money spent in each year for that purpose; (iii) whether furniture or any other equipment for the use of the aforesaid official residence, has been purchased at Government expense during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (iv) if so, the amount spent on them? (c) Will he state

(i) separately, the number of units of electricity and water that have been used at this official residence during each month of the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (ii) the amount of money spent by the relevant Ministry for electricity and water used at the above mentioned official residence in each month of the aforesaid years? (d) If not, why?

Program Schedule to Ampara 15.09.08 9.00 A. M. Visiting Ampara Night at GA Circuit Bungalow in Ampara 16.09.08 8.00 A. M. Leaving from Ampara To Akkaraipattu M.Court 9.00 A. M. Court starts at 9.00 A. M. After Court case visiting Divisional Secretariat and Pradhasiya Sabha in Alaiyadivembu 2.00 P. M. Leaving from Akkaraipattu to Komari and Pottuvil 01. ( The Hon. Neomal Perera - Deputy Minister of Fisheries) , .

1998 53 37 () . 1996 2 61 (1) () () . . - - . . . . CD , , . . . " " . . - According to the UN Regulations, after 23 years of rule in a certain area by a particular party, it comes under the control of the party that had been ruling because they had been enforcing police powers as well as judicial powers, and law and order had been under their control. So, with the international support, the United National Party handed over the North and the East to the LTTE. Whoever gave the idea to the LTTE to close the Mavil-Aru sluice gates have misled them. Otherwise, they would have had their own way in the North and the East and the Government would not have carried out an operation on humanitarian grounds to safeguard the people who are living in that area. So, on some misleading information, the LTTE closed the sluice gates of Mavil-Aru and the Government had to intervene to safeguard the human rights of the people in the North and the East. Even today they are carrying out a war to safeguard the human rights of the Tamil people who are under the clutches of the LTTE. The Tamil people living in Colombo are living peacefully with the Sinhalese and the Muslims without being extorted. It is the people living in the North and the East who are being extorted. Today, the LTTE is not allowing free passage even to the United Nations. -[Interruption.] Hon. Member, read the newspapers today. The LTTE is not allowing free passage to the people. In the Thoppigala incident, there were no Tamil, Sinhala or Muslim civilian casualties. The Government allowed free passage for them to go to any place that they wish. Today the Government is carrying out a war on humanitarian grounds. It is not a war against humanity or against the Tamils; it is a war against treacherous rule of the LTTE leader, Prabhakaran.

Honourable TNA Members, I believe you have come here in numbers because they voted for you and if you go for a democratic election in the North and the East, you will never be able to be elected to Parliament. Definitely, you will not come. Several Members of the TNA have told me personally that they do not like to go for an election. They do not mind going for a referendum and extending the Presidents term of office till 2017. But, they do not want to go for an election; they prefer to go for a referendum. I emphasize this because they told me personally that they will never be re-elected. Accordingly, His Excellency the President has given a lot of freedom to the Tamils and he is now fighting for the freedom of the Tamil people living in Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu. As soon as they are liberated and allowed free passage - the Government will takeover Kilinochchi in a few days - the LTTE will again have to go to the jungles in Mullaitivu to fight the war. So, please tell your leader and your brethren who are taking to arms to lay down their arms, sign a peace agreement and come for a democratic election like in the East. Like one of your brothers who is now the Chief Minister of the Eastern Province, they can come to Temple Trees, they can go to Japan, to Europe, all over the world and develop the country and the places where they have been living. This is your duty. You have to do it; you have to develop that area. You take the salaries given by Parliament, enjoy the perks and benefits and just read out some letters given by your party leadership and keeping them for record. This is exactly what is being done by the JVP as well as the UNP. There is a huge crisis within your party. You all do not want to accept what the President is doing to this country. Go to the South and see the development. Take the proposed fisheries supermarket at Peliyagoda. We can call it a real supermarket. We will have a restaurant in this supermarket where you can select fish from the fisheries outlets, get it prepared there and eat. That is the kind of development that Sri Lanka is moving towards. Also, take the proposed harbour in Dikovita in Wattala area to be built at a cost of eight billion rupees. So, Hon. Members, we are honoured to be a part of this Government. I am telling you, I am not a person who has voted for the Government, but today we are proud to be a part of the Government. Everyday we cannot work. We have a short lifespan and during that period when we can work, we should work. , . . 2,500 . . . , , . ; .
